name: HD 196050
scenarioDescription:
The HD 196050 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 196050 is a star with 1.31 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.42 times its radius. It is located 165.52 light years away from the solar system.

HD 196050 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 196050 system


HD 196050 b

HD 196050 b was discovered by the Anglo-Australian Telescope observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.51 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 196050 b is 1011.24 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 196050 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 196050, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Anglo-Australian Telescope.
